l.hi: Wele bette is roten Appul oute of horde

div.l: Than that he rote all the remenaunt
So fareth it by a rietous seruaunt
It is full lesse harme · to lete hym pacesse passe pace
Than he shende all the seruauntes in the place
Therfore his maister yaf hym acquitaunce
And badde hym goo with sorwe and myschaunce
And thus this Ioly prentise hadde his leue
Now lete hym ryote all the nyght or leue
And for ther is no thefe with oute a lowke
That helpeth hym to waste and to souke
Of that he bribe kan or borow may
A none he sente his bedde / and his array
Vn to a compere of his owne sorte
That loued dyse ryot add disporte disport disporte
And hadde a wife that helde for countenᵃaunce
A shoppe and swyued for sustynᵃaunce
Here be gynnytht the Cokys tale ⁊etcꝰetera
Lithen ⁊ lystenyth ⁊ herkenyth a right
And ye shul heren of a doughty knyght
Syr Iohn of Boundis was his name
He coude of norture and mochell of game
Thre sones the knyght had ⁊ wtith his body he hem wan
The eldest was a moche shrewe ⁊ sone he began
His brothern loued wele hir Fader ⁊ of hym were agast
The eldest deserued his Faders curs ⁊ had it at last
The good knyght his Fader leued so yore
That deth was comen hym ⁊ handlyd hym full sore
The good knyght cared sore sike there he lay
How his children shuld lyuen after his day
He hadde ben wyde where but noon husbond he was
Alle the londe that he had it was verrey purchas
Fayn he wolde it were drissed amonge hem alle
